title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 110.14 - Psychiatric examination; scope; form of report
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 110.14 - Psychiatric examination; scope; form of report

State Regulations
(a) The scope of the
psychiatric examinations prescribed by C PL 330.20 shall be as follows: (1)
the diagnosis and
prognosis made by the psychiatric examiner concerning the defendant's mental
condition; (2)
the
findings and evaluation made by the psychiatric examiner concerning the
defendant's mental condition; (3)
pertinent and significant factors
in the defendant's medical and psychiatric history; (4)
the psychiatric signs and
symptoms displayed by the defendant; and
(5)
the reasons for the opinion stated
by the psychiatric examiner (including, when defendant has a dangerous mental
disorder, an explanation as to why, because of defendant's mental condition, he
currently constitutes a physical danger to himself or others). (b) Form Y
prescribes the form and contents of the psychiatric examination reports
required to be filed under C PL 330.20. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
110.14

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
